page.title: 01HYDE HALL FARM
page.content: The owner of this farm is a Mr.Harold Phillips. His daughter runs the attached riding school. Three full time people are employed on the farm. The main work is{beef cattle raising {and pig rearing.}There are 100 cattle and 200 pigs. He has 250 acres of land. The farmers day starts at 7-45a.m. and finishes at 5-00p.m. The farm buildings were built in 1880 but the farm house was built 255 years before in 1625. The most important things done around the year are:- grass mowing, hay making, housing the cattle and feeding the cattle. The only crop they grow is grass.
